DOC.brief_summary: This prospective , single-center study . The patient peripheral arterial disease underwent abdominal aortograms runoff ( arteriogram low abdominal aorta artery legs ) Intravascular Ultrasound stent deployment enrol study . All patient participate study treat accord standard care . HYPOTHESIS The high degree plaque burden land zone effect restenosis peripheral artery intervention . SPECIFIC AIMS 1 . To obtain data eventually support development predictive model ISR Femoro-popliteal Disease METHODOLOGY Visit 1 : After consent give The subject receive standard follow-up care . A member research team collect information subject 's age , sex , ethnicity , medical information subject 's medical record . DOC.brief_title: Outcomes Femoro-popliteal Disease After Stent Deployment Under Intravascular Ultrasound Guidance
DOC.detailed_description: SUBJECT POPULATION : - The patient peripheral arterial disease underwent elective abdominal aortograms runoff peripheral artery intervention University Medical Center hospital , Lubbock Texas , January 2014 December 30 , 2015 . INCLUSION CRITERIA : - 25-89 year age - Admitted elective abdominal aortograms runoff . - Underwent Angioplasty and/or atherectomy stent placement Femoro-popliteal disease . - Intravascular ultrasound perform stent deployment . EXCLUSION CRITERIA : - Patients prior Femoro-popliteal artery surgery bypass limb . - Stent placement lesion inguinal ligament popliteal artery . - The patient present acute limb ischemia . - Unable follow-up TTUHSC clinic .

The patient present acute limb ischemia . Unable followup TTUHSC clinic .
